revisionDesc.change: Branched to a Bethlehem personography hold file. Kept Fulneck here.
Updated responsibility list, added more names and fields

event.desc: baptized at St Bartholomew's Church Armley 18 March, 1731 (7 March, 1730 OS). baptized in Church of England
interred at Ockbrook by John Ockershausen

person.note: (P/G/O)+^WILSON, Elizabeth (Betty) (1731-1765) b 22.02.1730 (OS) / 05.03.1731 (NS) Wortley Parish of Leeds occupation: stockiner reception: baptized St Bartholomew’s Church Armley 07.03.1730 (OS) / 18.03.1731 (NS), received Presbyterian Church, received society Holbeck 1752, received congregation Pudsey in Fulneck 27.04.1757, sisters’ house Gomersal January 1758, sisters’ house Ockbrook 10.04.1760, sacrament Ockbrook 16.04.1760 church office: received as acoluth July family: daughter of Thomas Wilson (b 1700) and Hannah (née Renner) (b 1701), sister of Benjamin (b 1727), Hannah (Horsfield) (b 1733), Esther (Klosé) (b 1736), Grace (b 1738) and Mary d 30.11.1765 aged 34 Ockbrook, interred Ockbrook by Br J Ockershausen 02.12.1765 1st section, 4th row, 14th grave on the left from 1st path

event.desc: received into childrens' congregation at Marienborn
received into the Great Girls Choir
blessed as a deaconess at Herrnhaag
interred at Fulneck by Samuel Benade

person.note: ANDERSON, Anna Rosina (1727-1803) b 09.08.1727 Berthelsdorf reception: baptised Lutheran Church, orphan house Marienborn c 1738, sisters’ house Marienborn 1739, received congregation Marienborn 1740, sacrament Herrnhaag 1741 congregation office: children and great girls bandkeeper 1742 Marienborn church orders: received as acoluth Herrnhaag 23.06.1743 blessed as deaconess Herrnhaag 04.07.1747 church service: assistant children’s oeconomy Marienborn 1743, Herrnhaag 1743, single sisters’ labourer Bethlehem, arrived 20.09.1748, returned Europe May 1764, arrived London 24.06.1764, arrived Marienborn 04.07.1764, arrived Herrnhut August 1764, single sisters’ labourer Fulneck 1765, Bedford 1765, Fulneck 1772-1801 d 20.02.1803 aged 75 sisters’ house Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br S T Benade 24.02.1803 grave 1136 - 2nd section, 52nd row, 2nd grave from path

event.desc: baptized at St Peter’s Church Birstall 21 July, 1743 (10 July, 1743 OS)

person.note: (LW/F/P)/x+^ATKINSON, Martha (1743-1768) b 28.06.1743 Scholes reception: baptized St Peter’s Church Birstall 10.07.1743 (OS) / 21.07.1743 (NS), received society Wyke 1758, sisters’ house Fulneck 26.11.1761, sisters’ house Littlemoor April 1762, received congregation Pudsey in Fulneck 12.04.1762, sacrament Pudsey in Fulneck 31.01.1767 family: daughter of James Atkinson (b 1715) and Elizabeth (née Mortimer) (b 1712), granddaughter of Sam Atkinson, sister of Thomas (b 1741), Grace (b 1745), Sarah (Webster) (b 1747), John (b 1749) and Elizabeth (b 1752), sister-in-law of Beatrix (née Ashley) and David Webster (b 1727) d 30.06.1768 aged 25 sisters’ house Littlemoor, interred Fulneck by Br P Böhler 02.07.1768 grave 357 - 1st section, 14th row, 4th grave from path

event.desc: received into society/sisters’ house at Cleckheaton
received into congregation at Fulneck 5 April, 1751 (25 March, 1751 OS)
received into new sisters' house at Fulneck
Father died and lived with mother and Betty Midgley
Her mother remarried and she moved in with her aunt
received from Great Girls to the Single Sisters Choir
interred at Fulneck by George Traneker

person.office: single sisters' labourer North of Ireland
assistant labourer among single sisters of country congregation at Gomersal

person.note: (P/F/G)CENNICK Sarah (Sally) (1712-1770) b 12.06.1712 (OS) / 23.06.1712 (NS) Reading resided: London 1729, returned Reading 1733, Kingswood 1741, East Tytherton 1744-1747 reception: baptized Church of England, received society Fetter Lane May 1739, left London for Germany 16.01.1746 (OS) / 27.01.1747 (NS), sisters’ house Herrnhaag 1747, received congregation Herrnhaag 1747, confirmed Herrnhaag 1747, sacrament Herrnhaag January 1748, sisters’ house Pudsey May 1748, Disciple’s House London July 1750-1751, Annenhof Holland January 1759, Herrnhut 12.08.1759, returned England 13.10.1760 congregation office: intercessor Herrnhaag 1748, congregation servant Yorkshire 1748 church orders: received as acoluth and blessed as deaconess Annenhof Holland 24.05.1759 church service: single sisters’ choir servant and choir helper Yorkshire 1748 - July 1750, single sisters’ labourer Dublin 1751, single sisters’ labourer North of Ireland 1752-1759, single sisters’ labour Bedford 13.10.1760, Lampeter c 1762, assistant labourer among single sisters and great girls of country congregations based Gomersal 16.01.1765 retired sisters’ house Fulneck 20.11.1769 family: daughter of George Cennick and Anna, sister of John (b 1718) and Anna (Stone), sister-in-law of Jane (née Bryant, later Moore) (b 1721) and ? Stone, aunt of John Cennick Stone (b 1743), and Sarah (b 1749), Ann Grove Cennick (b 1751) and Elizabeth Hannah (Swertner) (b 1752) d 24.01.1770 aged 57 sisters’ house Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br J Charlesworth 29.01.1770 grave 390 - 1st section, 16th row, 4th grave from path resited gravestone - right hand side of path to terrace, 4th stone from gate

person.note: (P/F/D)ssCLAGGETT, Elizabeth (Betty) (1715-1767) b 20.12.1715 (OS) / 31.12.1715 (NS) Castleford Yorkshire resided: Castleford 1715, London 1720, Castleford 1730, London 1734 - June 1742, October 1742 - July 1743, Fulneck settlement 29.09.1750 - 27.02.1753 reception: baptized All Saints’ Church Castleford 11.01.1715 (OS) / 22.01.1716 (NS), confirmed All Saints’ Church Castleford 1732, received society Fetter Lane 1740, received congregation London 25.12.1742 (OS) / 05.01.1743 (NS), sacrament London 05.02.1742 (OS) / 16.02.1743 (NS), left London for Yorkshire 24.06.1743 (OS) / 05.07.1743 (NS), sisters’ house Pudsey 24.07.1743 (OS) / 04.08.1743 (NS), sisters’ house Littlemoor 21.06.1748 (OS)/02.07.1748 (NS) - 03.05.1749 (OS)/14.05.1749 (NS), sisters’ house Fulneck 27.02.1753 church service: co-helper with single sisters Yorkshire 02.07.1743 (OS) / 13.07.1743 (NS), single sisters’ warden Yorkshire 16.08.1744 (OS) / 27.08.1744 (NS), single sisters’ labourer Yorkshire 05.10.1744 (OS) / 16.10.1744 (NS), resigned due to ill-health June 1748, single sisters’ warden Dukinfield 04.05.1749 (OS) / 15.05.1749 (NS) - 29.09.1750 family; daughter of Wiseman Claggett and Martha (née Clifton) (b 1691), sister of Susanna (b 1723), John Clifton (b 1725), Martha (b 1726), Ann (Shepley) (b 1728) and Catherine (b 1730), sister-in-law of Daniel Shepley (b 1721), aunt of John Benjamin (b 1767) and Anna Shepley (b 1770) d 12.08.1767 aged 51 sisters’ house Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br B La Trobe 14.08.1767 grave 324 - 1st section, 12th row, 6th grave from path

person.note: (P/F/O)PLANTA, Peter Jacob (1721-1815) b 16.12.1721 Jonköping Sweden educated: apprenticeship under Dr Hurlock Fulneck 1752 occupation: surgeon and apothecary resided: Fulneck 10.04.1755 - 1759, congregation house Ockbrook 19.10.1780, Green Lane Ockbrook 03.01.1781, 33 - 35 The Settlement Ockbrook 08.09.1784 reception: baptized Lutheran Church, received congregation Herrnhaag 31.12.1747, sacrament Herrnhaag 25.03.1748, regulated Germany, brethren’s house Lane End Pudsey 1752, brethren’s House Fulneck 1752-10.04.1755 congregation office: committee Ockbrook 26.12.1780, congregation council Ockbrook 25.06.1783, committee minute secretary Ockbrook 15.03.1790, disqualified from committee Ockbrook due to great age and infirmity 26.01.1812 church orders: ordained as deacon 18.04.1758 church service: assistant congregation doctor Fulneck 1751, congregation doctor Fulneck 1753, medical missionary Jamaica 28.05.1759, returned UK 1780, congregation doctor and assistant labourer Ockbrook 19.10.1780 m Anna Magdalen(e) Sierin (b 1723) St Wilfrid’s Church Calverley 10.04.1755 by direction of the congregation - widowed 17.12.1793 family: son of Jacob Planta and Martha, son-in-law of Thomas Sier and Dorothy, father of Anna Johanna (Collis) (b 1756), Benigna (b 1758) and Johannes (b 1764), father-in-law of David Collis (b 1753) and Elizabeth (née Hutchinson) (b 1765), grandfather of Peter (b 1782), Anna (b 1783), Margaret (Hull) (b 1787), Mary (Nesbit) (b 1789), David (b 1791), Benigna (b 1794), James (b 1796), John Collis (b 1799), and Peter John (b 1804) and James Christian Planta (b 1805), d 06.05.1815 aged 93 Ockbrook, interred Ockbrook by Br Traneker 13.05.1815 2nd section, 10th row, 1st grave on the right by 1st path

event.desc: began house meetings at mother’s house in Ossett

received into society at Fetter Lane
formed societies for Bible reading and prayer in Yorkshire; requested assistance of John Töltschig in Yorkshire 1739
requested Moravians take over Yorkshire societies

received into congregation at Fulneck privately by Count Zinzendorf
bought Thomas Hutchinson’s estate (adjacent to Fallneck) 27 October, 1749 (16 October, 1749)
sold Fulneck estate to Moravian Church in name of James Charlesworth

person.office: reader of public prayers Christ Church Newgate Street, London
person.occupation: evangelist at Huddersfield, Halifax, Wakefield, Bingley, and Bedford
person.note: (Y)INGHAM, Benjamin (1712-1772) b 11.06.1712 Ossett educated: Batley Grammar School (with Jacob Rogers), Oxford University (with John and Charles Wesley) resided: Ossett, Aberford North Yorkshire reception: baptized Dewsbury minster 17.06.1712, received congregation Yorkshire at Fulneck privately by Count Zinzendorf 27.07.1749 church orders: ordained Anglican clergyman by Bishop John Potter Oxford 01.06.1735 church service: member of ‘Holy Club’ at Oxford, began house meetings at mother’s house in Ossett Yorkshire 1734, appointed reader of public prayers Christ Church Newgate Street London 1735, sailed from London on the ss Simmonds 14.10.1735, arrived Savannah Georgia 23.02.1736, returned England 1737, received society Fetter Lane 1738, evangelist Huddersfield, Halifax, Wakefield and Bingley (with Charles Delamotte) and Bedford (with Francis Okely) 1738, formed societies for Bible reading and prayer 1739, before long 50 of these in Yorkshire - requested assistance of John Töltschig in Yorkshire 1739, requested Moravians take over Yorkshire societies 1741, Bedford (with William Delamotte at the start of the revival there) 1741, handed Yorkshire societies to Moravians 1742, sailed Harwich for Germany 25.05.1743 (OS), returned England 20.09.1743 (OS) / 01.10.1743 (NS), arrived Yorkshire 27.09.1743 (OS) / 08.10.1743 (NS), bought William Moss’ Fallneck estate Pudsey 20.04.1744 (OS) / 01.05.1744 (NS), built up his own connexion after handing over West Yorkshire societies to the Moravians bought Thomas Hutchinson’s estate (adjacent to Fallneck) 16.10.1749 (OS) / 27.10.1749 (NS), sold Fulneck estate to Moravian Church in name of James Charlesworth 11.09.1754 other service: hymn writer, one of 3 who presented the loyal address to King George II 27.04.1744 unity office: attended General Synod Hirschberg 1743, General Synod Herrnhaag May 1747 m Lady Margaret Hastings (b 1700) at the residence of the Earl of Huntingdon London 12.11.1741 - widowed 30.04.1768 family: son of William Ingham (b 1667) and Susannah (née Casselhouse) (b 1674), brother of William (b 1698), Susannah (Whitaker, later Fearnley) (b 1701), Elizabeth (b 1703, Joseph (b 1706), Rachel (b 1709), Hannah (Nettleton) (b 1715) and John (b 1715), brother-in-law of Mary (née Smithson) (b 1704), Isaac Whitaker (b 1684), John Fearnley, Joseph Nettleton (b 1708) and Hannah (née Westerman) (b 1722), and Earl of Huntingdon uncle of William (b 1730) and Joshua Ingham (b 1740), Isaac Whitaker (b 1731), John Nettleton (b 1743) and Benjamin Ingham (b 1753) father of Ignatius (b 1746), father-in-law of Elizabeth (née Moon), grandfather of Theophilus (b 1808) d 08.12.1772 aged 60 Aberford

person.note: (LW)SPANGENBERG, August Gottlieb (1704-1792) b 15.07.1704 Hohenstein Klettenberg educated: grammar school Ilefeld, University of Jena 1722 qualifications: MA1726 occupation: professor Halle University 1732, assistant director Orphan House Halle, dismissed Orphan House 27.02.1733 resided: at Br Brockmer’s house in Fetter Lane London 05.04.1741, Little Wild Street London 19.06.1741-26.06.1742 reception: received congregation Herrnhut 1733 congregation office: elder Herrnhut 1733 church orders: ordained as deacon Georgia by Br D Nitschmann 1737 ordained as presbyter consecrated as bishop (68 [6]) Marienborn by Brn N L Zinzendorf, G P Müller and F von Watteville 15.06.1744 church service: evangelist Copenhagen 1733, accompanied missionaries to St Croix, negotiated agreement with the Society of Suriname in Amsterdam to allow evangelisation of slaves in Suriname 1734, London 1735, leader of first group of Moravian colonists to America, sailed from London on the Two Brothers, arrived Savannah Georgia March 1735, Pennsylvania 15.03.1736, St Thomas 1736, mission to the Cherokee Indians Georgia 1737, returned Europe 1739, arrived London 24.10.1739, returned Germany December 1739 provincial office: general helper England London 26.03.1741, transferred Yorkshire from London 26.06.1742 (OS) / 07.07.1742 (NS), arrived Smith House 03.07.1742 (OS) / 14.07.1742 (NS), handed over office of general helper to Br F W Neisser 16.07.1743 (OS) / 27.07.1743 (NS), returned Germany 22.07.1743 (OS) / 02.08.1743 (NS), returned Yorkshire to sort out problems, left London 24.10.1743 (OS) / 04.11.1743 (NS), returned Germany, left London 02.01.1743 (OS) / 13.01.1744 (NS), sailed Harwich 05.01.1743 (OS) / 16.01.1744 (NS), sailed from Amsterdam on the Jacob, arrived Newcastle 12.08.1744 (OS) / 23.08.1744 (NS), sailed Newcastle 04.09.1744 (OS) / 15.09.1744 (NS), superintendent America, arrived New York 25.10.1744, arrived Bethlehem 30.11.1744, returned Europe, sailed from New York on the third voyage of the Irene 15.10.1749, arrived London 21.11.1749, tour of inspection of European communities 1750, returned America c June 1752, survey of land for new work in North Carolina 1752, returned Marienborn 1753, returned America, sailed from Gravesend on the eighth voyage of the Irene 15.03.1754, arrived New York 15.04.1754, served Bethlehem 1754, North Carolina 1759, Pennsylvania 1760, recalled Germany 1762 unity office: head of theological seminary Barby 1749-51, unity elder Berthelsdorf 1762 other service: board of directors Society for the Furtherance of the Gospel 1741-1744, author Biography of Zinzendorf (1773), Idea Fidei Fratrum (1777), Evangelical theory of Missions (1784), hymn writer m (1) Eva Maria Immig (née Ziegelbauer) 05.03.1740 Marienborn – widowed 1751 m (2) Maria Elizabeth (Martha) Miksch (née Jähne) 20.05.1754 Germany – widowed 26.03.1789 family: son of George Spangenberg (Lutheran clergyman) and Elizabeth (née Nesen) d 18.09.1792 aged 88 Berthelsdorf, interred Herrnhut 23.09.1792

person.note: EDWARDS, William (1798‐1879) b 26.07.1798 Derby educated: boys’ school Ockbrook, boys’ school Fulneck 1810, Fulneck Academy 1814-16, reception: baptized St Werburgh’s Church Derby 29.07.1798, little boy Ockbrook 1808, great boy Fulneck 1810, received congregation Fulneck 12.02.1815, single brother Fulneck 1816, sacrament Fulneck 16.11.1817 church orders: ordained as deacon ordained as presbyter consecrated as bishop (149 [87]) Herrnhut by Brn J M Nitschmann, C W Matthiesen and F J H Nielsen 30.08.1857 church service: teacher boys’ school Fulneck 1816, society labourer/congregation labourer Kimbolton and Stow 1825, private tutor Germany 1827, congregation labourer Lower Wyke 1828, London 1836, Salem 1837, Dublin 1841, Baildon 1844, Gracehill 1846, Fulneck 1850-52 provincial offices: committee to establish Moravian College 1847-59, provincial helper/elder Ockbrook 1852, deputy General Synod 1857, retired Ockbrook 1863 other service: hymn writer m Elizabeth Jackson (b 1807) St Wilfrid’s Church Calverley 24.10.1828 family: son of John Edwards (b 1772) and Sarah (Sally) (née Smith) (b 1777), brother of Elizabeth Ann (b 1803), John George (b 1805), Sarah (b 1807), Edward (b 1811) and Fanny Elizabeth (b 1819), father of William Martyn (b 1831), Anne (b 1833), William Jackson (b 1835), Sarah Catherine (Baxter) (b 1836), Mary Elizabeth (Shawe) (b 1838), Fanny Edith (b 1841) and John Herbert (b 1843),d 18.03.1879 aged 80 Ockbrook interred Ockbrook by Brn H E Blandford and J H Baxter 22.03.1879 3rd section, 1st row, 10th grave on the right from 2nd path

event.desc: married Mary Susanna Liley at St Mary’s Church Droylsden
ordained as a presbyter at Fulneck by John Rogers
interred at Chelsea by J A Porter

person.office: deputy at General Synod at Herrnhut
deputy at General Synod at Herrnhut
person.note: CLEMENS, Godfrey (Gottfried) (1818‐1882) b 01.05.1818 Genadendal South Africa educated: school for missionaries’ children Kleinwelke 1825, pädagogium Niesky 1830, seminary Gnadenfeld 1836-38 resided: 42 Wilberforce Road Finsbury Park London N 1881 church orders: ordained as deacon 1845 ordained as presbyter Fulneck by Br J Rogers 05.07.1853 church service: teacher boys’ school Fairfield 1838, boys’ school Kleinwelke 1841, pädagogium Niesky 1845, single brethren’s labourer Fulneck 1847, congregation labourer Ballinderry 1850, London October 1852, Baildon 1854, Lower Wyke 1861, Dublin 28.08.1863, Fulneck September 1865-81 provincial offices: deputy General Synod Herrnhut 1848 and 1869, provincial elder London 1881, College Committee (ex-officio) 1881 m Mary Susanna Liley (b 1821) St Mary’s Church Droylsden 02.04.1850 family: son of Anton Martin August Clemens, father of Lydia Helena (Swire) (b 1851), Frederic (b 1852), Mary Ellinor (Hahn) (b 1854), Amelia Louisa (Mumford) (b 1855), Godfrey (b 1857), Theodor Liley (b 1858), Annie (b 1860), Emily (b 1862) and Charlotte Elizabeth (b 1864), d 15.03.1882 aged 63 Finsbury Park London, interred Chelsea by Br J A Porter 18.03.1882 south west square, 5th row, 17th grave

event.desc: received into the congregation at Devonport
ordained as a deacon at Gracehill Samuel Benade
married Mary Jane Brownlee at St Wilfrid’s Church Calverley
interred at Fulneck by Joseph Hutton Willey

person.education: apprentice in father’s watchmaker and Jewellery business in Devonport
person.note: LIBBEY, John Pearse (1796‐1871) b 07.01.1796 Liskeard Cornwall occupation: apprentice in father’s watchmaker and Jewellery business Devonport - 1813 resided: Plymouth Dock (Devonport) 1805-1813, boarding house Fulneck September 1868 reception: received congregation Devonport 30.07.1809, sacrament Devonport 16.02.1812 congregation service: organist Devonport - 1813 church orders: accepted as acoluth 1818 ordained as deacon Gracehill by Br S T Benade church service: teacher boys’ school Fairfield 29.08.1813, boys’ school Wellhouse 1818, single brethren’s labourer and schoolkeeper Gracehill 17.03.1821, single brethren’s labourer and warden Fulneck July 1824, congregation labourer Baildon 14.01.1828, Gracefield November 1831, Baildon August 1834, Woodford and Eydon July 1841, Bristol May 1845, London March 1850, Fulneck 26.10.1852 and home missionary Crook ?-1860, congregation labourer and director girls’ boarding school Fairfield 16.10.1865, retired Fulneck September 1868 m Mary Jane Brownlee (b 1803) St Wilfrid’s Church Calverley 14.01.1828 family: father of Sarah Elizabeth (b 1829), John Daniel (b 1830), Mary Pearse (Weiss) (b 1832), Harriet Jane (Connor) (b 1834) and Henry Cornelius (b 1837), d 12.06.1871 aged 75 years 5 months Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br J H Willey 14.06.1871 grave 1965 - 2nd section, 80th row, 1st grave by path - stone missing

event.desc: received into the congregation at Niesky

person.note: HOLMES, John Beck (1767‐1843) b Johannes HOLM 03.11.1767 Copenhagen educated: boys’ school Christiansfeld 1777, pädagogium Niesky 1780, seminary Barby 1787 reception: baptized Lutheran Church, received congregation Niesky 23.09.1781, sacrament Niesky 20.12.1783, church orders: accepted as acoluth 1792 ordained as deacon Fulneck by Br G Traneker 14.08.1799 ordained as presbyter consecrated as bishop (123 [61]) Herrnhut by Brn C A Baumeister, G M Schneider and F W Foster 18.08.1825 church service: teacher pädagogium Niesky 1789, tutor to Siebold von Seidlitz 1790, teacher boys’ school Fulneck August 1791, single brethren’s labourer Fulneck 26.03.1798, congregation labourer Lower Wyke 1800, Ayr 1804, Gracefield 1810, Dublin 1812, Fulneck 1824, retired Fulneck 1837 other service: author/publisher Historical sketches of the Missions of the United Brethren (1818), History of the Protestant Church of the United Brethren Vol. 1 (1825), Vol. 2 (1830) m (1) Mary Radley (b 1771) St Peter’s Church Birstall 05.05.1800 – widowed 07.10.1828 m (2) Mary Mortimer (b 1780) St Wilfrid’s Church Calverley 07.12.1829 family: son of Peter Stevensen Holm (Captain of Greenland whaler) d 1769), father of stillborn son (1804), 2 sons and Catherine (b 1807) d 03.09.1843 aged 75 Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br J Rogers 08.09.1843 grave 1670 - 2nd section, 72nd row, 6th grave from path
